CHARACTER_INFO.BACKGROUND: Born into a modest family of woodworkers, Hawthorne had an untroubled childhood. His magical talents were revealed when, while wandering into the nearby forest, he was attacked by a pack of wild dogs, and conjured a barrier to protect himself. He was taken to Guild Island, where he excelled in his apprenticeship, thanks in part to an older mage, Lennart Galen, who acted as a mentor and protected him from the worst of the often cutthroat Mage Guild politics. During this time he also developed a friendly rivalry, and brief but unsuccessful romantic relationship with a fellow copper, Alisandra Vasco. When their ranking silver mage was promoted to gold, Hawthorne and Alisandra were the top candidates to replace him, and the rivalry turned much less friendly. A minor and unexplained mishap during Hawthorne's research project proved embarassing for him, and Alisandra was selected, leaving Hawthorne to take a less prestigious assignment outside the regular hierarchy. Hawthorne believes that Alisandra sabotaged his experiment, and is determined to return the favor someday.
CHARACTER_INFO.APPEARANCE: He also has a blue tattoo on his right shoulder, and a yellow tatto on his left ribs.

SKILL.OPTION_ALIAS: with a small group of attacks
SKILL.NAME: Spell Aim: Energy Bolt, Fracture Matter

SKILL.NOTES: In this course, students focus on geology, oceanography, astronomy, weather, and climate. Students follow a program of online study days that alternate with review-and-assessment days. Lessons include extensive animations, hands-on laboratory activities, reference book study, and collaborative activities with virtual classmates.

Students explore the relationship between matter and energy by investigating force and motion, the structure of atoms, the structure and properties of matter, chemical reactions, and the interactions of energy and matter. Students develop skill in measuring, solving problems, using laboratory apparatuses, following safety procedures, and adhering to experimental procedures. Students focus on inquiry-based learning, with hands-on laboratory investigations making up half of the learning experience.
